definition: Land areas defined by their relationship to water bodies, including boundaries, connections, and proximity to seas or lakes.

positive_examples: The rocky shoreline stretched for miles along the Atlantic coast.
Sicily is a large island in the Mediterranean Sea.
The narrow isthmus connects the two peninsulas across the bay.
We walked along the sandy beach at sunset.
Switzerland is completely landlocked by surrounding countries.
The harbor sits where the land meets the ocean.
negative_examples: The mountain peak towered above the valley floor.
Highway 101 runs through the central plains.
The forest trail wound through dense woodland.
Desert sands stretched endlessly in all directions.
The river carved a deep canyon through solid rock.
Urban sprawl covered the fertile farmland.
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: MountainArea, DesertRegion, ForestLand, UrbanArea
